to environmental factors that affect intergenerational chronic disease susceptibility. Maternal overweight and obesity, 
excessive gestational weight gain, gestational diabetes mellitus and multiple micronutrient deficiencies trigger 
detrimental effects in utero and increase the risk of fetal congenital anomalies and obstetric complications.
These findings highlight the urgent need to reduce levels of obesity and diet-related NCDs,
